Re-Open Leon Schools Overview:

The First Day of School for students has been pushed back to Wednesday, August 19th. Teachers will return on the 12th and have an opportunity to attend CANVAS training sessions on the 10th and 11th.

Masks will be required on buses, during class transitions and when not able to social distance 6 feet. Most classrooms will not have 6 feet of social distancing and parents should expect their children to wear masks in these cases. Schools will get creative in providing opportunities for students to have "mask breaks" to take the masks off in secure locations.

When a student or staff member tests positive we will notify the appropriate audiences and work with the Leon County Health Department to contact trace, decide if quarantines are required and discuss possible classroom or other closures. Each situation will be handled individually to decide the safest and best decision based on the facts of the positive case.

Please visit https://www.leonschools.net/reopenleon for more information about the plans to re-open schools in August.

The funding for this proposal will not require the district to borrow any new money and is funded from dollars that are restricted for this purpose.

This is just part of the plan to re-imagine our school district in the months to come. Look for more details over the next few weeks.

We would also like to thank all of our School Board Members for their input and leadership on this issue.
